overview: XPMEM (Cross-Page Memory) is a Linux kernel module that provides shared memory functionality for inter-process communication by allowing multiple processes to access a shared memory region. XPMEM facilitates efficient data exchange and communication between processes with reduced overhead and latency.
core_features: Shared memory access for inter-process communication
Enables multiple processes to read and write shared memory
Reduced data transfer latency and inter-process synchronization
Kernel module integration for memory sharing
